ratings.comment: Learning to research and how citations work is useful. Prof grades unnecessarily hard on the case emails and takes points off for subjective things. Doesn't give revision opportunities like some professors do in GB360 and gives pretty vague criticisms despite taking large points off. Also I had assignments ungraded for 2 months.

The class sucks, but Melanie is a decent professor. There is a lot of homework, but no tests. 1 presentation and 1 business report you work on for the last month. The homework is easy and busy work mainly. There is a good amount of reading, but you can skim it for a talking point for discussions. You can miss 4 classes before your grade drops.

This is one of the worst professors I've had. It does not help that it is also in one of the most pointless classes I've taken. The final project for GB360 is a portfolio where you showcase your best work and revise it. I am writing this on 4/29 and more than half of my course has not been graded. Do not know what to do right now. Find another prof

Gen Bus 300 is basically an easy class where you polish up your business writing skills and working on presentations. Melanie gives way too many papers to do each week and doesn't give feedback on them until way late in semester until all done and feedback can't help you. At end of semester didn't even put scores in. Worst professor I had.

Very unorganized. Due dates unclear, varied from the schedule posted online many times. Would not be my first choice if I had to take this class again. Very kind and means well, but just not organized.

Of all the classes I've taken at UW-Madison, this was by far the worst. Not because of the content, but because of the professor. Melanie is the epitome of unorganized and ineffective. Class time was wasted on strange, often irrelevant, details and nobody ever knew what was going on. I STRONGLY recommend taking this class with literally anyone else

Even though there is a lot of work, it's expected. Receiving grades a month or two later is frustrating. Most disappointing is not knowing your standing in the class till the end of the semester. Calendar and dropbox due dates rarely match up and this causes confusion. Emails go unanswered. Overall seems unorganized, not impressed.

Best professor I've had. She's super laid back and available to help. She makes seemingly boring content very interesting, I learned a ton on a topic I thought I already understood. That being said there is a ton of work. Quizzes, assignments, papers, and multiple group projects. She acknowledges it, but there is nothing she can do to lessen it.

I liked Melanie as a person. She is extremely nice and helpful. With that being said- she is super busy so she doesn't answer emails or answer them days later. You have two group projects (1 is fairly large) and two large papers. She is really flexible and often gives extensions. Just remember to be patient because she is a lot easier then others

Melanie for ProComm is highly recommended. She loves to laugh at herself which puts the entire class in a great mood. She gives you an advance on quizzes - you will have to read - but she'll let you use the reading if you print it. Assignments become overwhelming around Spring Break, but all doable. You'll have like 3 group presentations. Have fun!

She is awesome. Class is relaxed to begin with but she's a nice change from many other business school instructors. Don't buy the text book if she says it's required. She just says you need it because the department tells her she needs to have one. She is helpful and funny and always is in a good mood. Grading is also easy.
High standards and talks about lots of interesting stuff so the class isn't as boring as it could be.

Melanie has a great sense of humor and the class is pretty low key. However I found her to be rather vague and unhelpful with many of the assignment expectations. It turns out she is a fairly easy grader in the end, but she tends to start off with one or two harsh grades on the first assignments. Also, she is very approachable during office hours.

Very nice and funny lady. A lot of time consuming busy work but she is an easy grader on all the assignments. The only ones that are graded hard are memo 2 and the short report so watch out. The directions for those are hard to understand but she explains things well at office hours.

Useful class that all business students have to take. Not too difficult, she is a fairly easy grader and the skills learned in class are useful to know. Good personality, nothing special about her. Not a bad class to take with her.
Awesome teacher.  Hilarious which helps keep class interesting and fun.  VERY fair grader.  Seriously take this class with her.
